Package jetbrains.exodus.env

Class EnvironmentConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • jetbrains.exodus.AbstractConfig
      • jetbrains.exodus.env.EnvironmentConfig
  • public class EnvironmentConfig
extends AbstractConfig
    Specifies settings of Environment. Default settings are specified by DEFAULT which is immutable. Any newly created EnvironmentConfig has the same settings as DEFAULT.

    As a rule, the EnvironmentConfig instance is created along with the Environment one. E.g., creation of Environment with some tuned garbage collector settings can look as follows: 

         final EnvironmentConfig config = new EnvironmentConfig();
     final Environment env = Environments.newInstance(""dbDirectory", config.setGcFileMinAge(3).setGcRunPeriod(60000));

    Some setting are mutable at runtime and some are immutable. Immutable at runtime settings can be changed, but they won't take effect on the Environment instance. Those settings are applicable only during Environment instance creation.

    Some settings can be changed only before the database is physically created on storage device. E.g., LOG_FILE_SIZE defines the size of a single Log file (.xd file) which cannot be changed for existing databases. It makes sense to choose values of such settings at design time and hardcode them.

    You can define custom processing of changed settings values by AbstractConfig.addChangedSettingsListener(ConfigSettingChangeListener). Override ConfigSettingChangeListener.beforeSettingChanged(String, Object, Map) to pre-process mutations of settings and ConfigSettingChangeListener.afterSettingChanged(String, Object, Map) to post-process them.

    See Also:
    Environment, Environment.getEnvironmentConfig()

      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static java.lang.String CHECK_PAGES_AT_RUNTIME
      Xodus performs check of consistency of pages loaded from disk.
      static java.lang.String CIPHER_BASIC_IV
      Defines basic IV (initialization vector) which will be used to encrypt the database.
      static java.lang.String CIPHER_ID
      Defines id of StreamCipherProvider which will be used to encrypt the database.
      static java.lang.String CIPHER_KEY
      Defines the key which will be used to encrypt the database.
      static EnvironmentConfig DEFAULT  
      static java.lang.String ENV_CLOSE_FORCEDLY
      If is set to true then Environment.close() doest't check if there are unfinished transactions.
      static java.lang.String ENV_COMPACT_ON_OPEN
      If is set to true then the Environment will compact itself on opening.
      static java.lang.String ENV_FAIL_FAST_IN_READONLY
      If is set to true and ENV_IS_READONLY is also true then the Environment obligatorily creates transactions for which Transaction.isReadonly() is true.
      static java.lang.String ENV_GATHER_STATISTICS
      If is set to true then the Environment gathers statistics.
      static java.lang.String ENV_IS_READONLY
      If is set to true then the Environment instance is read-only.
      static java.lang.String ENV_MAX_PARALLEL_READONLY_TXNS
      Deprecated.
      static java.lang.String ENV_MAX_PARALLEL_TXNS
      Defines the number of transactions that can be started in parallel.
      static java.lang.String ENV_MONITOR_TXNS_CHECK_FREQ
      If ENV_MONITOR_TXNS_TIMEOUT is non-zero then stuck transactions monitor starts and checks Environment's transactions with this frequency (period) specified in milliseconds.
      static java.lang.String ENV_MONITOR_TXNS_EXPIRATION_TIMEOUT
      Defines Transaction expiration timeout in milliseconds.
      static java.lang.String ENV_MONITOR_TXNS_TIMEOUT
      Defines Transaction timeout in milliseconds.
      static java.lang.String ENV_READONLY_EMPTY_STORES
      If is set to true and ENV_IS_READONLY is also true then Environment.openStore(String, StoreConfig, Transaction) doesn't try to create a Store, but returns an empty immutable instance instead.
      static java.lang.String ENV_STOREGET_CACHE_MAX_VALUE_SIZE  
      static java.lang.String ENV_STOREGET_CACHE_MIN_TREE_SIZE  
      static java.lang.String ENV_STOREGET_CACHE_SIZE
      Defines the size of the "store-get" cache.
      static java.lang.String ENV_TXN_DOWNGRADE_AFTER_FLUSH
      If is set to true then any upgraded Transaction will downgrade itself after Transaction.flush().
      static java.lang.String ENV_TXN_REPLAY_MAX_COUNT
      Defines the number of times which a Transaction can try to flush without attempts to upgrade (switch to an exclusive mode).
      static java.lang.String ENV_TXN_REPLAY_TIMEOUT
      Defines the number of millisecond which a Transaction can try to flush without attempts to upgrade (switch to an exclusive mode).
      static java.lang.String ENV_TXN_SINGLE_THREAD_WRITES
      If is set to true then any write operation can be performed only in the thread which the transaction was created in.
      static java.lang.String ENV_TXN_TRACE_FINISH
      If is set to true then each transaction, read/write or read-only, saves stack trace when it is finished (aborted or committed).
      static java.lang.String GC_ENABLED
      If is set to true then the database garbage collector is enabled.
      static java.lang.String GC_FILES_DELETION_DELAY
      Defines the number of milliseconds which deletion of any successfully cleaned Log file (.xd file) is postponed for.
      static java.lang.String GC_FILES_INTERVAL
      Deprecated.
      static java.lang.String GC_MIN_FILE_AGE
      Defines the minimum age of a Log file (.xd file) to consider it for cleaning by the database garbage collector.
      static java.lang.String GC_MIN_UTILIZATION
      Defines percent of minimum database utilization.
      static java.lang.String GC_RENAME_FILES
      If is set to true the database garbage collector renames files rather than deletes them.
      static java.lang.String GC_RUN_EVERY
      If set to nonzero value, GC is forced every this number of seconds.
      static java.lang.String GC_RUN_PERIOD
      Defines the number of milliseconds after which background cleaning cycle (single run of the database garbage collector) can be repeated if the previous one didn't reach required utilization.
      static java.lang.String GC_START_IN
      Defines the number of milliseconds which the database garbage collector is postponed for after the Environment is created.
      static java.lang.String GC_TRANSACTION_ACQUIRE_TIMEOUT
      Defines timeout in milliseconds which is used by the database garbage collector to acquire exclusive Transaction for its purposes if GC_USE_EXCLUSIVE_TRANSACTION is true.
      static java.lang.String GC_TRANSACTION_TIMEOUT
      Defines timeout in milliseconds which is used by the database garbage collector to reclaim non-expired data in several files inside single GC Transaction acquired exclusively.
      static java.lang.String GC_USE_EXCLUSIVE_TRANSACTION
      If is set to true the database garbage collector tries to acquire exclusive Transaction for its purposes.
      static java.lang.String GC_USE_EXPIRATION_CHECKER
      Deprecated.
      static java.lang.String GC_UTILIZATION_FROM_FILE
      If is not empty, defines full path to the file with stored utilization.
      static java.lang.String GC_UTILIZATION_FROM_SCRATCH
      If is set to true then database utilization will be computed from scratch before the first cleaning cycle (single run of the database garbage collector) is triggered, i.e.
      static java.lang.String LOG_ALLOW_RAM_DISK
      For DataReaderWriterProvider.DEFAULT_READER_WRITER_PROVIDER used as DataReaderWriterProvider service provider interface implementation, if is set to true then the database can be opened on RAM-disk.
      static java.lang.String LOG_ALLOW_REMOTE
      For DataReaderWriterProvider.DEFAULT_READER_WRITER_PROVIDER used as DataReaderWriterProvider service provider interface implementation, if is set to true then the database can be opened on a remote storage.
      static java.lang.String LOG_ALLOW_REMOVABLE
      For DataReaderWriterProvider.DEFAULT_READER_WRITER_PROVIDER used as DataReaderWriterProvider service provider interface implementation, if is set to true then the database can be opened on a removable storage.
      static java.lang.String LOG_CACHE_FREE_PHYSICAL_MEMORY_THRESHOLD
      Deprecated.
      Because of upcoming release of virtual threads feature this property is deprecated.
      static java.lang.String LOG_CACHE_GENERATION_COUNT
      Defines the number of generations of non-blocking LogCache.
      static java.lang.String LOG_CACHE_NON_BLOCKING
      If is set to true the LogCache uses lock-free data structures.
      static java.lang.String LOG_CACHE_OPEN_FILES
      Defines the maximum number of open files that LogCache maintains in order to reduce system calls to open and close files.
      static java.lang.String LOG_CACHE_PAGE_SIZE
      Defines the size in bytes of a single page (byte array) in the LogCache.
      static java.lang.String LOG_CACHE_READ_AHEAD_MULTIPLE
      Defines the number of successive pages to be read at once in case of LogCache miss.
      static java.lang.String LOG_CACHE_SHARED
      If is set to true the LogCache is shared.
      static java.lang.String LOG_CACHE_USE_NIO
      Deprecated.
      Because of upcoming release of virtual threads feature this property is deprecated.
      static java.lang.String LOG_CACHE_USE_SOFT_REFERENCES
      If is set to true LogCache uses soft references for holding cached pages.
      static java.lang.String LOG_CACHE_WARMUP
      If is set to true LogCache will populate itself with database file pages right after the database is opened using this EnvironmentConfig instance.
      static java.lang.String LOG_CLEAN_DIRECTORY_EXPECTED
      If is set to true then the Log constructor fails if the database directory is not clean.
      static java.lang.String LOG_CLEAR_INVALID
      If is set to true then the Log constructor implicitly clears the database if it occurred to be invalid when opened.
      static java.lang.String LOG_DATA_READER_WRITER_PROVIDER
      Defines fully-qualified name of the DataReaderWriterProvider service provider interface implementation which will be used to create DataReader and DataWriter instances.
      static java.lang.String LOG_DURABLE_WRITE
      If is set to true forces file system's fsync call after each committed or flushed transaction.
      static java.lang.String LOG_FILE_SIZE
      Defines the maximum size in kilobytes of a single Log file (.xd file).
      static java.lang.String LOG_FORCE_CHECK_DATA_CONSISTENCY
      Forces to check data consistency of the database on opening.
      static java.lang.String LOG_FULL_FILE_READ_ONLY
      If is set to true then each complete and immutable Log file (.xd file) is marked with read-only attribute.
      static java.lang.String LOG_LOCK_ID
      Defines the debug identifier to be written to the lock file alongside with other debug information.
      static java.lang.String LOG_LOCK_TIMEOUT
      Defines the number of milliseconds the Log constructor waits for the lock file.
      static java.lang.String LOG_PROCEED_DATA_RESTORE_AT_ANY_COST
      Forces data restore routine to proceed even if it is not possible to restore all the data.
      static java.lang.String LOG_SKIP_INVALID_LOGGALE_TYPE  
      static java.lang.String LOG_SYNC_PERIOD
      Sets the period in milliseconds to force file system's fsync call that often if LOG_DURABLE_WRITE is switched off.
      static java.lang.String MANAGEMENT_ENABLED
      If is set to true then the Environment exposes two JMX managed beans.
      static java.lang.String MANAGEMENT_OPERATIONS_RESTRICTED
      If is set to true then exposed JMX managed beans cannot have operations.
      static java.lang.String MEMORY_USAGE
      Defines absolute value of memory in bytes that can be used by the LogCache.
      static java.lang.String MEMORY_USAGE_PERCENTAGE
      Defines percent of max memory (specified by the "-Xmx" java parameter) that can be used by the LogCache.
      static java.lang.String META_SERVER
      If set to some value different from null, expose created environment via given server.
      static java.lang.String PROFILER_ENABLED
      If is set to true database profiler is enabled.
      static java.lang.String TREE_DUP_MAX_PAGE_SIZE
      Defines the maximum size of page of duplicates sub-B+Tree.
      static java.lang.String TREE_MAX_PAGE_SIZE
      Defines the maximum size of page of B+Tree.
      static java.lang.String TREE_NODES_CACHE_SIZE
      Deprecated.
      static java.lang.String USE_VERSION1_FORMAT

      Forces to check data consistency of the database on opening.
      EnvironmentConfig setLogLockId​(java.lang.String id)
      Sets the debug identifier to be written to the lock file alongside with other debug information.
      EnvironmentConfig setLogLockTimeout​(long millis)
      Sets the number of milliseconds the Log constructor waits for the lock file.
      EnvironmentConfig setLogProceedDataRestoredAtAnyCost​(boolean proceedDataRestoredAtAnyCost)
      Forces data restore routine to proceed even if it is not possible to restore all the data.
      EnvironmentConfig setLogSkipInvalidLoggableType​(boolean skipInvalidLoggableType)  
      EnvironmentConfig setLogSyncPeriod​(long millis)
      Sets the period in milliseconds to force file system's fsync call that often if LOG_DURABLE_WRITE is switched off.
      EnvironmentConfig setManagementEnabled​(boolean managementEnabled)
      Set true if the Environment should expose two JMX managed beans.
      EnvironmentConfig setManagementOperationsRestricted​(boolean operationsRestricted)
      If isManagementEnabled() then set false in order to expose operations with JMX managed beans in addition to attributes.
      EnvironmentConfig setMemoryUsage​(long maxMemory)
      Sets absolute value of memory in bytes that can be used by the LogCache.
      EnvironmentConfig setMemoryUsagePercentage​(int memoryUsagePercentage)
      Sets percent of max memory (specified by the "-Xmx" java parameter) that can be used by the LogCache.
      EnvironmentConfig setMetaServer​(MetaServer metaServer)  
      EnvironmentConfig setMutable​(boolean isMutable)
      Set true for making it possible to change settings of this EnvironmentConfig instance.
      EnvironmentConfig setProfilerEnabled​(boolean enabled)
      Set true to enable database profiler.

      Sets the value of the setting with the specified key.

      • CHECK_PAGES_AT_RUNTIME

        public static final java.lang.String CHECK_PAGES_AT_RUNTIME
        Xodus performs check of consistency of pages loaded from disk. This option allows to enable/disable this check.

        Disabling this check should improve general performance of database but decreases durability guaranties.

        Default value is true.

        Mutable at runtime: no

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CIPHER_ID

        public static final java.lang.String CIPHER_ID
        Defines id of StreamCipherProvider which will be used to encrypt the database. Default value is null, which means that the database won't be encrypted. The setting cannot be changed for existing databases. Default value is null.

        Mutable at runtime: no

        See Also:
        CIPHER_KEY, CIPHER_BASIC_IV, StreamCipher, StreamCipherProvider, Constant Field Values

      • CIPHER_KEY

        public static final java.lang.String CIPHER_KEY
        Defines the key which will be used to encrypt the database. The key is expected to be a hex string representing a byte array which is passed to StreamCipher.init(byte[], long). Is applicable only if CIPHER_ID is not null. The setting cannot be changed for existing databases. Default value is null.

        Mutable at runtime: no

        See Also:
        CIPHER_ID, CIPHER_BASIC_IV, StreamCipher, StreamCipher.init(byte[], long), StreamCipherProvider, Constant Field Values

      • CIPHER_BASIC_IV

        public static final java.lang.String CIPHER_BASIC_IV
        Defines basic IV (initialization vector) which will be used to encrypt the database. Basic IV is expected to be random (pseudo-random) and unique long value. Basic IV is used to calculate relative IVs which are passed to StreamCipher.init(byte[], long). Is applicable only if CIPHER_ID is not null. The setting cannot be changed for existing databases. Default value is 0L.

        Mutable at runtime: no

        See Also:
        CIPHER_ID, CIPHER_KEY, StreamCipher, StreamCipher.init(byte[], long), StreamCipherProvider, Constant Field Values

      • LOG_DURABLE_WRITE

        public static final java.lang.String LOG_DURABLE_WRITE
        If is set to true forces file system's fsync call after each committed or flushed transaction. By default, is switched off since it creates great performance overhead and can be controlled manually.

        Mutable at runtime: yes

      • LOG_CACHE_PAGE_SIZE

        public static final java.lang.String LOG_CACHE_PAGE_SIZE
        Defines the size in bytes of a single page (byte array) in the LogCache. This number of bytes is read from MappedByteBuffer or RandomAccessFile at a time.

        If the LogCache is shared (LOG_CACHE_SHARED) all Environments should be configured to use single LogCache page size.

        Default value is 64 * 1024.

        Mutable at runtime: no

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LOG_CACHE_OPEN_FILES

        public static final java.lang.String LOG_CACHE_OPEN_FILES
        Defines the maximum number of open files that LogCache maintains in order to reduce system calls to open and close files. The more open files is allowed the less system calls are performed in addition to reading or mapping files. This value can notably affect performance of database warm-up. Default value is 500. Open files cache is shared amongst all open environments.

        Mutable at runtime: no

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LOG_CACHE_USE_NIO

        @Deprecated
public static final java.lang.String LOG_CACHE_USE_NIO
        Deprecated.
        Because of upcoming release of virtual threads feature this property is deprecated.
        If is set to true any immutable file can be mapped in memory provided there is enough physical memory. On cache miss, LogCache at first tries to check if there is corresponding mapped byte buffer and copies cache page from the buffer, otherwise reads the page from RandomAccessFile. If is set to false then LogCache always reads RandomAccessFile on cache miss. Default value was true before version 1.2.3. As of 1.2.3, default value is false.

        Mutable at runtime: no

        See Also:
        LOG_CACHE_FREE_PHYSICAL_MEMORY_THRESHOLD, Constant Field Values

      • LOG_CACHE_FREE_PHYSICAL_MEMORY_THRESHOLD

        @Deprecated
public static final java.lang.String LOG_CACHE_FREE_PHYSICAL_MEMORY_THRESHOLD
        Deprecated.
        Because of upcoming release of virtual threads feature this property is deprecated.
        If LOG_CACHE_USE_NIO is true defines the minimum size in bytes of free physical memory maintained by the cache memory-mapped files on the host where the JVM runs. On cache miss, LogCache checks if corresponding file is mapped in memory, and if it is not and if free physical memory amount is greater than threshold specified by this setting, tries to map the file in memory. Default value is 1_000_000_000L bytes, i.e. ~1GB.

        Mutable at runtime: no

        See Also:
        LOG_CACHE_USE_NIO, Constant Field Values

      • LOG_CACHE_SHARED

        public static final java.lang.String LOG_CACHE_SHARED
        If is set to true the LogCache is shared. Shared cache caches raw binary data (contents of .xd files) of all Environment instances created in scope of this class loader. By default, the LogCache is shared.

        Mutable at runtime: no

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LOG_CACHE_NON_BLOCKING

        public static final java.lang.String LOG_CACHE_NON_BLOCKING
        If is set to true the LogCache uses lock-free data structures. Default value is true.

        Mutable at runtime: no

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LOG_CACHE_GENERATION_COUNT

        public static final java.lang.String LOG_CACHE_GENERATION_COUNT
        Defines the number of generations of non-blocking LogCache. Is applicable only if LOG_CACHE_NON_BLOCKING is set to true. The higher number of generations is, the higher the cache hit rate is and CPU ticks necessary to get a single page from the cache. Default value is 2.

        Mutable at runtime: no

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LOG_CACHE_USE_SOFT_REFERENCES

        public static final java.lang.String LOG_CACHE_USE_SOFT_REFERENCES
        If is set to true LogCache uses soft references for holding cached pages. The cache still uses not more memory than it is configured by MEMORY_USAGE or MEMORY_USAGE_PERCENTAGE settings, but JVM GC can reclaim memory used by the cache on a heavy load surge. On the other hand, use of soft references results in greater JVM GC load and greater general CPU consumption by the cache. So one can choose either memory-flexible, or CPU-optimal cache. Default value is false.

        Mutable at runtime: no

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LOG_CACHE_READ_AHEAD_MULTIPLE

        public static final java.lang.String LOG_CACHE_READ_AHEAD_MULTIPLE
        Defines the number of successive pages to be read at once in case of LogCache miss. Reading successive pages can reduce amount of random access to database files. It can be useful in workloads like application warm-up. Default value is 1 which means that no read-ahead strategy is applied.

        Mutable at runtime: yes

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LOG_CACHE_WARMUP

        If is set to true LogCache will populate itself with database file pages right after the database is opened using this EnvironmentConfig instance. Default value is false.

        Mutable at runtime: no

      • LOG_DATA_READER_WRITER_PROVIDER

        public static final java.lang.String LOG_DATA_READER_WRITER_PROVIDER
        Defines fully-qualified name of the DataReaderWriterProvider service provider interface implementation which will be used to create DataReader and DataWriter instances. This setting can be used to customize storageL define in-memory one, in-cloud, etc. Default value is DataReaderWriterProvider.DEFAULT_READER_WRITER_PROVIDER which means that file system must be used as a storage. Several settings are applicable only to FileDataReaderWriterProvider used: LOG_DURABLE_WRITE, LOG_SYNC_PERIOD, LOG_CACHE_OPEN_FILES, LOG_FULL_FILE_READ_ONLY, LOG_CACHE_USE_NIO, LOG_CACHE_FREE_PHYSICAL_MEMORY_THRESHOLD.

        Mutable at runtime: no

      • ENV_IS_READONLY

      • ENV_FAIL_FAST_IN_READONLY

        public static final java.lang.String ENV_FAIL_FAST_IN_READONLY
        If is set to true and ENV_IS_READONLY is also true then the Environment obligatorily creates transactions for which Transaction.isReadonly() is true. Read-only transactions fail-fast with ReadonlyTransactionException on attempt to modify data. If is set to false and ENV_IS_READONLY is set to true then the Environment creates transaction that allow to accumulate changes but cannot be flushed ot committed since the Environment is read-only. Default value is true.

        Mutable at runtime: yes

        See Also:
        ENV_IS_READONLY, Constant Field Values

      • ENV_READONLY_EMPTY_STORES

        public static final java.lang.String ENV_READONLY_EMPTY_STORES
        If is set to true and ENV_IS_READONLY is also true then Environment.openStore(String, StoreConfig, Transaction) doesn't try to create a Store, but returns an empty immutable instance instead. Default value is false.

        Mutable at runtime: yes

        See Also:
        ENV_IS_READONLY, Constant Field Values

      • ENV_MONITOR_TXNS_TIMEOUT

        public static final java.lang.String ENV_MONITOR_TXNS_TIMEOUT
        Defines Transaction timeout in milliseconds. If transaction doesn't finish in this timeout then it is reported in logs as stuck along with stack trace which it was created with. Default value is 0 which means that no timeout for a Transaction is defined. In that case, no monitor of stuck transactions is started. Otherwise it is started for each Environment, though consuming only a single Thread amongst all environments created within a single class loader.

        Mutable at runtime: no

        See Also:
        Transaction, ENV_MONITOR_TXNS_CHECK_FREQ, Constant Field Values

      • ENV_MONITOR_TXNS_EXPIRATION_TIMEOUT

        public static final java.lang.String ENV_MONITOR_TXNS_EXPIRATION_TIMEOUT
        Defines Transaction expiration timeout in milliseconds. If transaction doesn't finish in this timeout then it is forced to be finished. Default value is 8 hours. 0 value means that no expiration for a Transaction is defined. In that case, no monitor of stuck transactions is started. Otherwise it is started for each Environment, though consuming only a single Thread amongst all environments created within a single class loader.

        Mutable at runtime: no

        See Also:
        Transaction, ENV_MONITOR_TXNS_CHECK_FREQ, Constant Field Values

      • ENV_MONITOR_TXNS_CHECK_FREQ

        public static final java.lang.String ENV_MONITOR_TXNS_CHECK_FREQ
        If ENV_MONITOR_TXNS_TIMEOUT is non-zero then stuck transactions monitor starts and checks Environment's transactions with this frequency (period) specified in milliseconds. Default value is 60000, one minute.

        Mutable at runtime: no

        See Also:
        Transaction, ENV_MONITOR_TXNS_TIMEOUT, Constant Field Values

      • GC_ENABLED

      • GC_START_IN

      • GC_MIN_UTILIZATION

        public static final java.lang.String GC_MIN_UTILIZATION
        Defines percent of minimum database utilization. Default value is 50. That means that 50 percent of free space in raw data in Log files (.xd files) is allowed. If database utilization is less than defined (free space percent is more than 50), the database garbage collector is triggered.

        Mutable at runtime: yes

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • GC_RENAME_FILES

        public static final java.lang.String GC_RENAME_FILES
        If is set to true the database garbage collector renames files rather than deletes them. Default value is false. It makes sense to change this setting only for debugging and troubleshooting purposes.

        Mutable at runtime: yes

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • GC_USE_EXPIRATION_CHECKER

      • GC_MIN_FILE_AGE

        public static final java.lang.String GC_MIN_FILE_AGE
        Defines the minimum age of a Log file (.xd file) to consider it for cleaning by the database garbage collector. The age of the last (the newest, the rightmost) Log file is 0, the age of previous file is 1, etc. Default value is 2.

        Mutable at runtime: yes

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • GC_FILES_INTERVAL

        @Deprecated
public static final java.lang.String GC_FILES_INTERVAL
        Deprecated.
        Defines the number of new Log files (.xd files) that must be created to trigger if necessary (if database utilization is not sufficient) the next background cleaning cycle (single run of the database garbage collector) after the previous cycle finished. Default value is 3, i.e. GC can start after each 3 newly created Log files.

        Mutable at runtime: yes

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • GC_RUN_PERIOD

        public static final java.lang.String GC_RUN_PERIOD
        Defines the number of milliseconds after which background cleaning cycle (single run of the database garbage collector) can be repeated if the previous one didn't reach required utilization. Default value is 5000.

        Mutable at runtime: yes

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • GC_UTILIZATION_FROM_SCRATCH

        public static final java.lang.String GC_UTILIZATION_FROM_SCRATCH
        If is set to true then database utilization will be computed from scratch before the first cleaning cycle (single run of the database garbage collector) is triggered, i.e. shortly after the database is open. In addition, can be used to compute utilization information at runtime by just modifying the setting value. Default value is false.

        Mutable at runtime: yes

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • GC_UTILIZATION_FROM_FILE

        public static final java.lang.String GC_UTILIZATION_FROM_FILE
        If is not empty, defines full path to the file with stored utilization. Is used on creation of an Environment to update .xd files' utilization before the first cleaning cycle (single run of the database garbage collector) is triggered. In addition, can be used to reload utilization information at runtime by just modifying the setting value. Format of the stored utilization is expected to be the same as created by the "-d" option of the Reflect tool. Default value is empty string.

        Mutable at runtime: yes

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • GC_USE_EXCLUSIVE_TRANSACTION

        public static final java.lang.String GC_USE_EXCLUSIVE_TRANSACTION
        If is set to true the database garbage collector tries to acquire exclusive Transaction for its purposes. In that case, GC transaction never re-plays. In order to not block background cleaner thread forever, acquisition of exclusive GC transaction is performed with a timeout controlled by the GC_TRANSACTION_ACQUIRE_TIMEOUT setting. Default value is true.

        Mutable at runtime: yes

        See Also:
        GC_TRANSACTION_ACQUIRE_TIMEOUT, GC_TRANSACTION_TIMEOUT, Transaction.isExclusive(), Constant Field Values

      • GC_TRANSACTION_ACQUIRE_TIMEOUT

        public static final java.lang.String GC_TRANSACTION_ACQUIRE_TIMEOUT
        Defines timeout in milliseconds which is used by the database garbage collector to acquire exclusive Transaction for its purposes if GC_USE_EXCLUSIVE_TRANSACTION is true. Default value is 1000.

        Mutable at runtime: yes

        See Also:
        GC_USE_EXCLUSIVE_TRANSACTION, GC_TRANSACTION_TIMEOUT, Transaction.isExclusive(), Constant Field Values

      • GC_TRANSACTION_TIMEOUT

        public static final java.lang.String GC_TRANSACTION_TIMEOUT
        Defines timeout in milliseconds which is used by the database garbage collector to reclaim non-expired data in several files inside single GC Transaction acquired exclusively. GC_USE_EXCLUSIVE_TRANSACTION should be true. Default value is 500.

        Mutable at runtime: yes

        See Also:
        GC_USE_EXCLUSIVE_TRANSACTION, GC_TRANSACTION_ACQUIRE_TIMEOUT, Transaction.isExclusive(), Constant Field Values

      • GC_FILES_DELETION_DELAY

        public static final java.lang.String GC_FILES_DELETION_DELAY
        Defines the number of milliseconds which deletion of any successfully cleaned Log file (.xd file) is postponed for. Default value is 5000.

        Mutable at runtime: yes

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • GC_RUN_EVERY

        public static final java.lang.String GC_RUN_EVERY
        If set to nonzero value, GC is forced every this number of seconds. Default value is 0 which means that GC is not forced periodically.

        Mutable at runtime: yes

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MANAGEMENT_ENABLED

        public static final java.lang.String MANAGEMENT_ENABLED
        If is set to true then the Environment exposes two JMX managed beans. One for environment statistics and second for controlling the EnvironmentConfig settings. Default value is true for non-Android OS, under Android it is always false.

        Mutable at runtime: no

        See Also:
        Environment.getStatistics(), Environment.getEnvironmentConfig(), Constant Field Values

      • MANAGEMENT_OPERATIONS_RESTRICTED

        public static final java.lang.String MANAGEMENT_OPERATIONS_RESTRICTED
        If is set to true then exposed JMX managed beans cannot have operations. Default value is true.

        Mutable at runtime: no

        See Also:
        MANAGEMENT_ENABLED, Constant Field Values

      • META_SERVER

        public static final java.lang.String META_SERVER
        If set to some value different from null, expose created environment via given server.

        Mutable at runtime: no

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • getCipherBasicIV

        public long getCipherBasicIV()
        Returns basic IV (initialization vector) which will be used to encrypt the database. Basic IV is expected to be random (pseudo-random) and unique long value. Basic IV is used to calculate relative IVs which are passed to StreamCipher.init(byte[], long). Is applicable only if CIPHER_ID is not null. The setting cannot be changed for existing databases. Default value is 0L.

        Mutable at runtime: no

        Returns:
        basic IV (initialization vector) which will be used to encrypt the database
        See Also:

      • getLogCacheOpenFilesCount

        public int getLogCacheOpenFilesCount()
        Returns the maximum number of open files that the LogCache maintains in order to reduce system calls to open and close files. The more open files is allowed the less system calls are performed in addition to reading or mapping files. This value can notably affect performance of database warm-up. Default value is 500. Open files cache is shared amongst all open environments.

        Mutable at runtime: no

        Returns:
        maximum number of open files

Open files cache is shared amongst all open environments.

        Mutable at runtime: no

      • getLogCacheUseNio

        @Deprecated
public boolean getLogCacheUseNio()
        Deprecated.
        Because of upcoming release of virtual threads feature this property is deprecated.
        Returns true if any immutable .xd file can be mapped in memory provided there is enough physical memory. On cache miss, LogCache at first tries to check if there is corresponding mapped byte buffer and copies cache page from the buffer, otherwise reads the page from RandomAccessFile. If is set to false then LogCache always reads RandomAccessFile on cache miss. Default value was true before version 1.2.3. As of 1.2.3, default value is false.

        Mutable at runtime: no

        Returns:
        true mapping of .xd files in memory is allowed
        See Also:
        getLogCacheFreePhysicalMemoryThreshold()

      • setLogCacheUseNio

        @Deprecated
public EnvironmentConfig setLogCacheUseNio​(boolean useNio)
        Deprecated.
        Because of upcoming release of virtual threads feature this property is deprecated.
        Set true to allow any immutable .xd file to be mapped in memory provided there is enough physical memory. On cache miss, LogCache at first tries to check if there is corresponding mapped byte buffer and copies cache page from the buffer, otherwise reads the page from RandomAccessFile. If is set to false then LogCache always reads RandomAccessFile on cache miss. Default value was true before version 1.2.3. As of 1.2.3, default value is false.

        Mutable at runtime: no

        Parameters:
        useNio - true is using NIO is allowed
        Returns:
        this EnvironmentConfig instance

      • getLogCacheFreePhysicalMemoryThreshold

        public long getLogCacheFreePhysicalMemoryThreshold()
        If LOG_CACHE_USE_NIO is true defines the minimum size in bytes of free physical memory maintained by the cache memory-mapped files on the host where the JVM runs. On cache miss, LogCache checks if corresponding file is mapped in memory, and if it is not and if free physical memory amount is greater than threshold specified by this setting, tries to map the file in memory. Default value is 1_000_000_000L bytes, i.e. ~1GB.
        Returns:
        minimum size in bytes of free physical memory

      • setLogCacheFreePhysicalMemoryThreshold

        public EnvironmentConfig setLogCacheFreePhysicalMemoryThreshold​(long freePhysicalMemoryThreshold)
        If LOG_CACHE_USE_NIO is true sets the minimum size in bytes of free physical memory maintained by the cache memory-mapped files on the host where the JVM runs. On cache miss, LogCache checks if corresponding file is mapped in memory, and if it is not and if free physical memory amount is greater than threshold specified by this setting, tries to map the file in memory. Default value is 1_000_000_000L bytes, i.e. ~1GB.
        Parameters:
        freePhysicalMemoryThreshold - minimum size in bytes of free physical memory
        Returns:
        this EnvironmentConfig instance

      • getLogCacheGenerationCount

        public int getLogCacheGenerationCount()
        Returns the number of generations of non-blocking LogCache. Is applicable only if LOG_CACHE_NON_BLOCKING is set to true. The higher number of generations is, the higher the cache hit rate is and CPU ticks necessary to get a single page from the cache. Default value is 2.
        Returns:
        number of generations of non-blocking LogCache

      • setLogCacheGenerationCount

        public EnvironmentConfig setLogCacheGenerationCount​(int generationCount)
        Sets the number of generations of non-blocking LogCache. Is applicable only if LOG_CACHE_NON_BLOCKING is set to true. The higher number of generations is, the higher the cache hit rate is and CPU ticks necessary to get a single page from the cache. Default value is 2.
        Parameters:
        generationCount - number of generations of non-blocking LogCache
        Returns:
        this EnvironmentConfig instance

      • getLogCacheUseSoftReferences

        public boolean getLogCacheUseSoftReferences()
        Returns true LogCache uses soft references for holding cached pages. The cache still uses not more memory than it is configured by MEMORY_USAGE or MEMORY_USAGE_PERCENTAGE settings, but JVM GC can reclaim memory used by the cache on a heavy load surge. On the other hand, use of soft references results in greater JVM GC load and greater general CPU consumption by the cache. So one can choose either memory-flexible, or CPU-optimal cache. Default value is false.

        Mutable at runtime: no

        Returns:
        true if LogCache should use soft references for holding cached pages

      • setLogCacheUseSoftReferences

        public EnvironmentConfig setLogCacheUseSoftReferences​(boolean useSoftReferences)
        Set true if LogCache should use soft references for holding cached pages. The cache still uses not more memory than it is configured by MEMORY_USAGE or MEMORY_USAGE_PERCENTAGE settings, but JVM GC can reclaim memory used by the cache on a heavy load surge. On the other hand, use of soft references results in greater JVM GC load and greater general CPU consumption by the cache. So one can choose either memory-flexible, or CPU-optimal cache. Default value is false.

        Mutable at runtime: no

        Parameters:
        useSoftReferences - true if LogCache should use soft references for holding cached pages
        Returns:
        this EnvironmentConfig instance

      • getLogCacheReadAheadMultiple

        public int getLogCacheReadAheadMultiple()
        Returns the number of successive pages to be read at once in case of LogCache miss. Reading successive pages can reduce amount of random access to database files. It can be useful in workloads like application warm-up. Default value is 1 which means that no read-ahead strategy is applied.
        Returns:
        number of successive pages to be read at once in case of LogCache miss

      • setLogCacheReadAheadMultiple

        public EnvironmentConfig setLogCacheReadAheadMultiple​(int readAheadMultiple)
        Sets the number of successive pages to be read at once in case of LogCache miss. Reading successive pages can reduce amount of random access to database files. It can be useful in workloads like application warm-up. Default value is 1 which means that no read-ahead strategy is applied.
        Parameters:
        readAheadMultiple - number of successive pages to be read at once in case of LogCache miss
        Returns:
        this EnvironmentConfig instance

        Mutable at runtime: no

        true if the database can be opened on RAM-disk
        Since:
        1.4.0

      • setLogAllowRamDisk

        public EnvironmentConfig setLogAllowRamDisk​(boolean allow)
        For DataReaderWriterProvider.DEFAULT_READER_WRITER_PROVIDER used as DataReaderWriterProvider service provider interface implementation, if is set to true then the database can be opened on RAM-disk. Attempt to open database on a storage of not allowed type results in StorageTypeNotAllowedException. Default value is false.

        Mutable at runtime: no

        Parameters:
        allow - true to allow using database located on RAM-disk
        Returns:
        this EnvironmentConfig instance
        Since:
        1.4.0

      • getLogDataReaderWriterProvider

        public java.lang.String getLogDataReaderWriterProvider()
        Returns fully-qualified name of the DataReaderWriterProvider service provide interface implementation which will be used to create DataReader and DataWriter instances. This setting can be used to customize storage: define in-memory one, in-cloud, etc. Default value is DataReaderWriterProvider.DEFAULT_READER_WRITER_PROVIDER which means that file system must be used as a storage. Several settings are applicable only if FileDataReaderWriterProvider is used: LOG_DURABLE_WRITE, LOG_SYNC_PERIOD, LOG_CACHE_OPEN_FILES, LOG_FULL_FILE_READ_ONLY, LOG_CACHE_USE_NIO, LOG_CACHE_FREE_PHYSICAL_MEMORY_THRESHOLD.

        Mutable at runtime: no

        Returns:
        fully-qualified name of the DataReaderWriterProvider service provide interface implementation

      • setLogDataReaderWriterProvider

        public EnvironmentConfig setLogDataReaderWriterProvider​(@NotNull
                                                        @NotNull java.lang.String provider)
        Sets fully-qualified name of the DataReaderWriterProvider service provide interface implementation which will be used to create DataReader and DataWriter instances. This setting can be used to customize storage: define in-memory one, in-cloud, etc. Default value is DataReaderWriterProvider.DEFAULT_READER_WRITER_PROVIDER which means that file system must be used as a storage. Several settings are applicable only if FileDataReaderWriterProvider is used: LOG_DURABLE_WRITE, LOG_SYNC_PERIOD, LOG_CACHE_OPEN_FILES, LOG_FULL_FILE_READ_ONLY, LOG_CACHE_USE_NIO, LOG_CACHE_FREE_PHYSICAL_MEMORY_THRESHOLD.

        Mutable at runtime: no

        Parameters:
        provider - fully-qualified name of the DataReaderWriterProvider service provide interface implementation
        Returns:
        this EnvironmentConfig instance

      • getEnvIsReadonly

        public boolean getEnvIsReadonly()
        Returns true if the Environment instance is read-only. Default value is false.

        Mutable at runtime: yes

        *WARNING* do not use this method to check if Environment is working in read-only mode at runtime. Please use Environment.isReadOnly() instead.

        Returns:
        true if the Environment instance is read-only

      • setEnvIsReadonly

        Mutable at runtime: yes

        Parameters:
        isReadonly - true to turn the Environment instance to read-only mode
        Returns:
        this EnvironmentConfig instance

      • getEnvFailFastInReadonly

        public boolean getEnvFailFastInReadonly()
        If is set to true and ENV_IS_READONLY is also true then the Environment obligatorily creates transactions for which Transaction.isReadonly() is true. Read-only transactions fail-fast with ReadonlyTransactionException on attempt to modify data. If is set to false and ENV_IS_READONLY is set to true then the Environment creates transaction that allow to accumulate changes but cannot be flushed ot committed since the Environment is read-only. Default value is true.

        Mutable at runtime: yes

        Returns:
        true if attempt to modify data won't fail immediately in read-only mode

      • setEnvFailFastInReadonly

        public EnvironmentConfig setEnvFailFastInReadonly​(boolean failFast)
        If is set to true and ENV_IS_READONLY is also true then the Environment obligatorily creates transactions for which Transaction.isReadonly() is true. Read-only transactions fail-fast with ReadonlyTransactionException on attempt to modify data. If is set to false and ENV_IS_READONLY is set to true then the Environment creates transaction that allow to accumulate changes but cannot be flushed ot committed since the Environment is read-only. Default value is true.

        Mutable at runtime: yes

        Parameters:
        failFast - true if attempt modify data shouldn fail immediately in read-only mode
        Returns:
        this EnvironmentConfig instance

      • getEnvReadonlyEmptyStores

        public boolean getEnvReadonlyEmptyStores()
        If is set to true and ENV_IS_READONLY is also true then Environment.openStore(String, StoreConfig, Transaction) doesn't try to create a Store, but returns an empty immutable instance instead. Default value is false.

        Mutable at runtime: yes

        Returns:
        true if attempt to create a Store won't fail immediately in read-only mode

      • getEnvStoreGetCacheSize

        public int getEnvStoreGetCacheSize()
        Returns the size of the "store-get" cache. The "store-get" cache can increase performance of Store.get(Transaction, ByteIterable) in certain cases. Default value is 0 what means that the cache is inactive. If the setting is mutated at runtime the cache is invalidated.

        Mutable at runtime: yes

        Returns:
        size of the "store-get" cache

      • getEnvMonitorTxnsTimeout

        public int getEnvMonitorTxnsTimeout()
        Returns Transaction timeout in milliseconds. If transaction doesn't finish in this timeout then it is reported in logs as stuck along with stack trace which it was created with. Default value is 0 which means that no timeout for a Transaction is defined. In that case, no monitor of stuck transactions is started. Otherwise it is started for each Environment, though consuming only a single Thread amongst all environments created within a single class loader.

        Mutable at runtime: no

        Returns:
        timeout of a Transaction in milliseconds
        See Also:
        getEnvMonitorTxnsCheckFreq()

      • setEnvMonitorTxnsTimeout

        public EnvironmentConfig setEnvMonitorTxnsTimeout​(int timeout)
        Sets Transaction timeout in milliseconds. If transaction doesn't finish in this timeout then it is reported in logs as stuck along with stack trace which it was created with. Default value is 0 which means that no timeout for a Transaction is defined. In that case, no monitor of stuck transactions is started. Otherwise it is started for each Environment, though consuming only a single Thread amongst all environments created within a single class loader.

        Mutable at runtime: no

        Parameters:
        timeout - timeout of a Transaction in milliseconds
        Returns:
        this EnvironmentConfig instance
        See Also:
        setEnvMonitorTxnsCheckFreq(int)

      • getEnvMonitorTxnsExpirationTimeout

        public int getEnvMonitorTxnsExpirationTimeout()
        Defines Transaction expiration timeout in milliseconds. If transaction doesn't finish in this timeout then it is forced to be finished. Default value is 8 hours. 0 value means that no expiration for a Transaction is defined. Otherwise it is started for each Environment, though consuming only a single Thread amongst all environments created within a single class loader.

        Mutable at runtime: no

        Returns:
        expiration timeout of a Transaction in milliseconds
        See Also:
        getEnvMonitorTxnsCheckFreq()

      • setEnvMonitorTxnsExpirationTimeout

        public EnvironmentConfig setEnvMonitorTxnsExpirationTimeout​(int timeout)
        Defines Transaction expiration timeout in milliseconds. If transaction doesn't finish in this timeout then it is forced to be finished. Default value is 8 hours. 0 value means that no expiration for a Transaction is defined. Otherwise it is started for each Environment, though consuming only a single Thread amongst all environments created within a single class loader.

        Mutable at runtime: no

        Parameters:
        timeout - timeout of a Transaction in milliseconds
        Returns:
        this EnvironmentConfig instance
        See Also:
        setEnvMonitorTxnsCheckFreq(int)

      • getEnvMonitorTxnsCheckFreq

        public int getEnvMonitorTxnsCheckFreq()
        If ENV_MONITOR_TXNS_TIMEOUT is non-zero then stuck transactions monitor starts and checks Environment's transactions with this frequency (period) specified in milliseconds. Default value is 60000, one minute.

        Mutable at runtime: no

        Returns:
        frequency (period) in milliseconds of checking stuck transactions
        See Also:
        getEnvMonitorTxnsTimeout()

      • setEnvMonitorTxnsCheckFreq

        public EnvironmentConfig setEnvMonitorTxnsCheckFreq​(int freq)
        If ENV_MONITOR_TXNS_TIMEOUT is non-zero then stuck transactions monitor starts and checks Environment's transactions with this frequency (period) specified in milliseconds. Default value is 60000, one minute.

        Mutable at runtime: no

        Parameters:
        freq - frequency (period) in milliseconds of checking stuck transactions
        Returns:
        this EnvironmentConfig instance
        See Also:
        setEnvMonitorTxnsTimeout(int), setEnvMonitorTxnsExpirationTimeout(int)

      • getGcMinUtilization

        public int getGcMinUtilization()
        Returns percent of minimum database utilization. Default value is 50. That means that 50 percent of free space in raw data in Log files (.xd files) is allowed. If database utilization is less than defined (free space percent is more than 50), the database garbage collector is triggered.

        Mutable at runtime: yes

        Returns:
        percent of minimum database utilization

      • setGcMinUtilization

        public EnvironmentConfig setGcMinUtilization​(int percent)
                                      throws InvalidSettingException
        Sets percent of minimum database utilization. Default value is 50. That means that 50 percent of free space in raw data in Log files (.xd files) is allowed. If database utilization is less than defined (free space percent is more than 50), the database garbage collector is triggered.

        Mutable at runtime: yes

        Parameters:
        percent - percent of minimum database utilization
        Returns:
        this EnvironmentConfig instance
        Throws:
        InvalidSettingException - percent is not in the range [1..90]

      • getGcRenameFiles

        public boolean getGcRenameFiles()
        If returns true the database garbage collector renames files rather than deletes them. Default value is false. It makes sense to change this setting only for debugging and troubleshooting purposes.

        Mutable at runtime: yes

        Returns:
        true if the database garbage collector should rename files rather than deletes them

      • getGcFileMinAge

        public int getGcFileMinAge()
        Returns the minimum age of a Log file (.xd file) to consider it for cleaning by the database garbage collector. The age of the last (the newest, the rightmost) Log file is 0, the age of previous file is 1, etc. Default value is 2.

        Mutable at runtime: yes

        Returns:
        minimum age of .xd file to consider it for cleaning by the database garbage collector

      • setGcFileMinAge

        public EnvironmentConfig setGcFileMinAge​(int minAge)
                                  throws InvalidSettingException
        Returns the minimum age of a Log file (.xd file) to consider it for cleaning by the database garbage collector. The age of the last (the newest, the rightmost) Log file is 0, the age of previous file is 1, etc. Default value is 2. The age cannot be less than 1.

        Mutable at runtime: yes

        Parameters:
        minAge - minimum age of .xd file to consider it for cleaning by the database garbage collector
        Returns:
        this EnvironmentConfig instance
        Throws:
        InvalidSettingException - minAge is less than 1.

Default value is 3, i.e. GC can start after each 3 newly created Log files.

        Mutable at runtime: yes

        Returns:
        number of new .xd files that must be created to trigger the next background cleaning cycle

      • getGcUtilizationFromScratch

        public boolean getGcUtilizationFromScratch()
        Returns true if database utilization will be computed from scratch before the first cleaning cycle (single run of the database garbage collector) is triggered, i.e. shortly after the database is open. In addition, can be used to compute utilization information at runtime by just modifying the setting value. Default value is false.

        Mutable at runtime: yes

        Returns:
        true if database utilization will be computed from scratch

      • setGcUtilizationFromScratch

        public EnvironmentConfig setGcUtilizationFromScratch​(boolean fromScratch)
        Set true if database utilization should be computed from scratch before the first cleaning cycle (single run of the database garbage collector) is triggered, i.e. shortly after the database is open. In addition, can be used to compute utilization information at runtime by just modifying the setting value. Default value is false.

        Mutable at runtime: yes

        Parameters:
        fromScratch - true if database utilization should be computed from scratch
        Returns:
        this EnvironmentConfig instance

      • getGcUtilizationFromFile

        public java.lang.String getGcUtilizationFromFile()
        Returns full path to the file with stored utilization. Is used on creation of an Environment to update .xd files' utilization before the first cleaning cycle (single run of the database garbage collector) is triggered. In addition, can be used to reload utilization information at runtime by just modifying the setting value. Format of the stored utilization is expected to be the same as created by the "-d" option of the Reflect tool. Default value is empty string.

        Mutable at runtime: yes

        Returns:
        if not empty, full path to the file with stored utilization.

      • setGcUtilizationFromFile

        public EnvironmentConfig setGcUtilizationFromFile​(java.lang.String file)
        Sets full path to the file with stored utilization. Is used on creation of an Environment to update .xd files' utilization before the first cleaning cycle (single run of the database garbage collector) is triggered. In addition, can be used to reload utilization information at runtime by just modifying the setting value. Format of the stored utilization is expected to be the same as created by the "-d" option of the Reflect tool. Default value is empty string.

        Mutable at runtime: yes

        Parameters:
        file - full path to the file with stored utilization
        Returns:
        this EnvironmentConfig instance

      • getGcUseExclusiveTransaction

        public boolean getGcUseExclusiveTransaction()
        Returns true if the database garbage collector tries to acquire exclusive Transaction for its purposes. In that case, GC transaction never re-plays. In order to not block background cleaner thread forever, acquisition of exclusive GC transaction is performed with a timeout controlled by the GC_TRANSACTION_ACQUIRE_TIMEOUT setting. Default value is true.

        Mutable at runtime: yes

        Returns:
        true if the database garbage collector tries to acquire exclusive Transaction
        See Also:
        getGcTransactionAcquireTimeout(), getGcTransactionTimeout()

      • setGcUseExclusiveTransaction

        public EnvironmentConfig setGcUseExclusiveTransaction​(boolean useExclusiveTransaction)
        Sets true if the database garbage collector should try to acquire exclusive Transaction for its purposes. In that case, GC transaction never re-plays. In order to not block background cleaner thread forever, acquisition of exclusive GC transaction is performed with a timeout controlled by the GC_TRANSACTION_ACQUIRE_TIMEOUT setting. Default value is true.

        Mutable at runtime: yes

        Parameters:
        useExclusiveTransaction - true if the database garbage collector should try to acquire exclusive Transaction
        Returns:
        this EnvironmentConfig instance
        See Also:
        setGcTransactionAcquireTimeout(int), setGcTransactionTimeout(int)

      • getGcTransactionAcquireTimeout

        public int getGcTransactionAcquireTimeout()
        Returns timeout in milliseconds which is used by the database garbage collector to acquire exclusive Transaction for its purposes if GC_USE_EXCLUSIVE_TRANSACTION is true. Default value is 1000.

        Mutable at runtime: yes

        Returns:
        timeout in milliseconds which is used by the database garbage collector to acquire exclusive Transaction
        See Also:
        getGcUseExclusiveTransaction(), getGcTransactionTimeout()

      • setGcTransactionAcquireTimeout

        public EnvironmentConfig setGcTransactionAcquireTimeout​(int txnAcquireTimeout)
        Sets timeout in milliseconds which is used by the database garbage collector to acquire exclusive Transaction for its purposes if GC_USE_EXCLUSIVE_TRANSACTION is true. Default value is 1000.

        Mutable at runtime: yes

        Parameters:
        txnAcquireTimeout - timeout in milliseconds which is used by the database garbage collector to acquire exclusive Transaction
        Returns:
        this EnvironmentConfig instance
        See Also:
        setGcUseExclusiveTransaction(boolean), setGcTransactionTimeout(int)

      • getGcTransactionTimeout

        public int getGcTransactionTimeout()
        Returns timeout in milliseconds which is used by the database garbage collector to reclaim non-expired data in several files inside single GC Transaction acquired exclusively. GC_USE_EXCLUSIVE_TRANSACTION should be true. Default value is 500.

        Mutable at runtime: yes

        Returns:
        timeout in milliseconds which is used by the database garbage collector to reclaim non-expired data in several files inside single Transaction acquired exclusively
        See Also:
        getGcUseExclusiveTransaction(), getGcTransactionAcquireTimeout()

      • setGcTransactionTimeout

        public EnvironmentConfig setGcTransactionTimeout​(int txnTimeout)
        Sets timeout in milliseconds which is used by the database garbage collector to reclaim non-expired data in several files inside single GC Transaction acquired exclusively. GC_USE_EXCLUSIVE_TRANSACTION should be true. Default value is 500.

        Mutable at runtime: yes

        Parameters:
        txnTimeout - timeout in milliseconds which is used by the database garbage collector to reclaim non-expired data in several files inside single Transaction acquired exclusively
        Returns:
        this EnvironmentConfig instance
        See Also:
        setGcUseExclusiveTransaction(boolean), setGcTransactionAcquireTimeout(int)

      • getGcFilesDeletionDelay

        public int getGcFilesDeletionDelay()
        Returns the number of milliseconds which deletion of any successfully cleaned Log file (.xd file) is postponed for. Default value is 5000.

        Mutable at runtime: yes

        Returns:
        number of milliseconds which deletion of any successfully cleaned .xd file is postponed for

      • setGcFilesDeletionDelay

        public EnvironmentConfig setGcFilesDeletionDelay​(int delay)
                                          throws InvalidSettingException
        Sets the number of milliseconds which deletion of any successfully cleaned Log file (.xd file) is postponed for. Default value is 5000.

        Mutable at runtime: yes

        Parameters:
        delay - number of milliseconds which deletion of any successfully cleaned .xd file is postponed for
        Returns:
        this EnvironmentConfig instance
        Throws:
        InvalidSettingException - delay is less than 0.

      • getGcRunEvery

        public int getGcRunEvery()
        GC is forced every this number of seconds. Default value is 0 which means that GC is not forced periodically.

        Mutable at runtime: yes

      • setGcRunEvery

        public EnvironmentConfig setGcRunEvery​(int seconds)
        Sets GC to be forced every this number of seconds. If the value is zero GC is not forced periodically. Default value is 0.

        Mutable at runtime: yes

      • isManagementEnabled

        public boolean isManagementEnabled()
        Return true if the Environment exposes two JMX managed beans. One for environment statistics and second for controlling the EnvironmentConfig settings. Default value is true for non-Android OS, under Android it is always false.

        Mutable at runtime: no

        Returns:
        true if the Environment exposes JMX managed beans

      • setManagementEnabled

        public EnvironmentConfig setManagementEnabled​(boolean managementEnabled)
        Set true if the Environment should expose two JMX managed beans. One for environment statistics and second for controlling the EnvironmentConfig settings. Default value is true for non-Android OS, under Android it is always false.

        Mutable at runtime: no

        Parameters:
        managementEnabled - true if the Environment should expose JMX managed beans
        Returns:
        this EnvironmentConfig instance

      • getManagementOperationsRestricted

        public boolean getManagementOperationsRestricted()
        If is set to true then exposed JMX managed beans cannot have operations. Default value is true.

        Mutable at runtime: no

        Returns:
        true if exposed JMX managed beans cannot have operations.
        See Also:
        isManagementEnabled()

      • setManagementOperationsRestricted

        public EnvironmentConfig setManagementOperationsRestricted​(boolean operationsRestricted)
        If isManagementEnabled() then set false in order to expose operations with JMX managed beans in addition to attributes.
        Parameters:
        operationsRestricted - false if JMX managed beans should expose operations in addition to attributes
        Returns:
        this EnvironmentConfig instance
